hints.content: First, we need to find $46\dfrac12$ centimeters on the number line.

$46\dfrac12$ is after $46$ but before $47$.

[[☃ image 1]]

There are $2$ equal parts, or halves, between each whole. We can label each tick.


[[☃ image 2]]

options.alt: A line plot that has, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 46 and 47. Between the labeled tick marks is an unlabeled tick mark equally spaced between 46 and 47. !
A line plot that has, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 46, 46 and one-half, and 47. The 46 and one-half tick mark is highlighted. !

hints.content:
Each dot represents one footprint. 

So, we need to count all of the dots on the line plot that represent  footprints that are $46\dfrac12$ centimeters long.  

[[☃ image 1]]

There are $\greenD5$ dots that represent footprints that are $46\dfrac12$ centimeters long.

options.alt: A line plot labeled Elephant footprint lengths (centimeters) shows, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 42, 43, 44, 45, 45, 47, 48, 49, and 50. An unlabeled tick mark appears in the middle between each labeled tick mark. Dots are plotted as follows: 1 dot above 43, 3 dots above the unlabeled tick mark between 44 and 45, 2 dots above 45, 4 dots above the unlabeled tick mark between 45 and 46, 5 dots above the unlabeled tick mark between 46 and 47, 3 dots above 47, 2 dots above 48, 1 dot above the unlabeled tick mark between 48 and 49, and 2 dots above the unlabeled tick mark between 49 and 50. The unlabeled tick mark between 46 and 47 and 5 dots above it are highlighted. !

hints.content:
Next, we need to find $48\dfrac12$ centimeters on the number line.

$48\dfrac12$ is after $48$ but before $49$.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A line plot that has, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 48, 48 and one-half, and 49. The 48 and one-half tick mark is highlighted. !

hints.content:
Then we need to count all of the dots on the line plot that represent footprints that are $48\dfrac12$ centimeters long.

[[☃ image 1]]

There is $\purpleD1$ dot that represent footprints that are $48\dfrac12$ centimeters long.

options.alt: A line plot labeled Elephant footprint lengths (centimeters) shows, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 42, 43, 44, 45, 45, 47, 48, 49, and 50. An unlabeled tick mark appears in the middle between each labeled tick mark. Dots are plotted as follows: 1 dot above 43, 3 dots above the unlabeled tick mark between 44 and 45, 2 dots above 45, 4 dots above the unlabeled tick mark between 45 and 46, 5 dots above the unlabeled tick mark between 46 and 47, 3 dots above 47, 2 dots above 48, 1 dot above the unlabeled tick mark between 48 and 49, and 2 dots above the unlabeled tick mark between 49 and 50. The unlabeled tick mark between 48 and 49 and 1 dot above it are highlighted. !

hints.content: To find how many more, we can subtract $\greenD5 - \purpleD1 =\blueD4$
$\blueD4$ more footprints are $46\dfrac12$ centimeters long than are $48\dfrac12$ centimeters long.

question.content:
The lengths of some elephant footprints are shown below.  

[[☃ image 1]]

**How many more footprints are $46\dfrac12$ cm long than are $48\dfrac12$ centimeters long?** 
 
[[☃ input-number 1]] footprints

options.alt: A line plot labeled Elephant footprint lengths (centimeters) shows, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 42, 43, 44, 45, 45, 47, 48, 49, and 50. An unlabeled tick mark appears in the middle between each labeled tick mark. Dots are plotted as follows: 1 dot above 43, 3 dots above the unlabeled tick mark between 44 and 45, 2 dots above 45, 4 dots above the unlabeled tick mark between 45 and 46, 5 dots above the unlabeled tick mark between 46 and 47, 3 dots above 47, 2 dots above 48, 1 dot above the unlabeled tick mark between 48 and 49, and 2 dots above the unlabeled tick mark between 49 and 50. !
